resources.string: Do you want enter your score?
This is the first time you launch the application in Game mode. Do you want to go in the help menu in order to learn the rules of the game?
This mode is made for expert in machine learning. Do you want to have some information about this mode?
Try again and do better to enter in the Top 10.
You need an active connection to the Internet to use this application. Please, turn on your Wifi or mobile data to be connected to Internet.
We have a server problem. Please try again later. Thank you for your comprehension.
You have successfully built the tree. You can visualize it by clicking the \"Tree view\" button.\nThank you for your help.
It seems that you may not be connected to the Internet anymore. Please check your Wifi connection or your mobile data.
The purpose of this game is to separate points of color. You have to gather points of the same color together. To do that, your job is to trace a line between these points.

When it is done, you can validate your line and try to do the same with the other part of the image. If you have managed to split points well enough into groups of different color, you will reach the next level. You may encounter difficulty in processing some images. In this case, you can skip to the next image.

A progress bar shows you the proportion of points that are already well enough separated and that will not be shown anymore on the screen. You have a certain amount of time to process the images. You begin the game with 20 seconds at the timer. Each time you validate your trace, you will gain 2 extra seconds. Time is a valuable ressource, be careful with it ! But do not hesitate to skip to an another image: you will see that sometimes it is worth the trouble of losing some resources to get a better situation for splitting. It is mandatory to have points on each side of the line in order to validate it.

At the beginning of each level, you have a stock of 100 points. After each split, this stock decreases by 5 points. Howewer, if you succeed in creating groups that contains points of one color, called pure groups, only 2 points will be removed from the stock. In this case, you will see the progress bar fill in. At the end of the level, the stock is added to your score. Then, in order to maximize your score, do your best to reduce the number of splits and build as more pure groups as possible.
This mode is designed for experts in machine learning. It allows the user to build a decision tree for a database he has chosen. This decision tree is used as a model to classify data (or objects).

These objects are represented in the form of Scatter Plots. The first view of this mode shows a serie of Scatter Plots made by combining two attributes. This pair used to generate the Scatter Plot is mentionned into the corresponding thumb.
When you have chosen a Scatter Plot among those present on the grid, you can process it exactly the same way as in the Game mode.

After a split, two child nodes of the current one are created in the tree and you can review the grid but only with objects contained in one of the new node created. It is possible to continue the processing of the node if you estimate that it is not pure enough. In the other case, the \"Stop\" button allows visualizing the other nodes.

A toggle button at the top-right of the view enables the user to trace only horizontal or vertical lines. This mode is used to compare trees built with machine learning algorithm based on decision tree. At any time, some information are available at the bottom of the screen. A local and a global error are provided.\nThe local error (LE) is the percentage of objects from the current node that are not part of the majority class in the node. Between parenthesis, there is the number of objects included in the current node compared to the total number of objects in the set.\nThe global error (GE) is the weighted sum of local errors of each leaf from the current tree. So, you have to minimize the local error for each node in order to reduce as far as possible the global error of the entire tree.

Each error are shown for the learning set (LS) and the test set (TS). These sets are disctinct subsets of all objects from the database. The learning set is the part of objects that are drawn on the screen. The test set is the rest of the objects that are hidden from the user in order to compare the model on non-processed data. \nDuring all the construction of the tree, the \"Tree view\" button makes it possible to have a hierarchical view of it. So you can browse each node by clicking on it. When you are at the current node, clicking on its ID allows the user to see the equation respected by all objects included in it.

A progress bar also shows the progression of the processing. The light blue part represents the proportion of visible objects on the screen. At the beginning, we are at the root of the tree and we can see all the objects of the database.
The grey part is not yet shown objects. After a split, only some objects are visible on the screen.
When there is dark blue in the bar, it means that some objects have been stopped and are already a part of the model.
A fully dark blue bar notifies the user that all objects are stopped and distributed among the leaves of the tree. At that moment, the tree is completely built and a model has been set up.

The Treece project is a game with a purpose. This application is a building tool for decision trees related to a master thesis on machine learning. The objective of this work is to estimate the capacity of humans to classify objects and compare it to supervised machine learning algorithms.
